paragraphs.body: The Dark Into Light Trivia Game is a quiz that directly corresponds to the online game, ${link_0}. When completed successfully, each quiz provides a five-part code which can be used in the game to unlock secret missions.
paragraphs.text: The Dark Into Light Trivia Game is a quiz that directly corresponds to the online game, Dark Into Light. When completed successfully, each quiz provides a five-part code which can be used in the game to unlock secret missions.

paragraphs.body: This trivia game can be accessed from a mobile device or a personal computer. It was made available on Nick.com shortly before the premiere of ${link_0} and removed from the site for a brief period of time following the finale.
paragraphs.text: This trivia game can be accessed from a mobile device or a personal computer. It was made available on Nick.com shortly before the premiere of Book Two: Spirits and removed from the site for a brief period of time following the finale.

paragraphs.body: The game includes information on characters from the show and instructions on how to play, in addition to the quiz itself. The questions and answers provided on this page represent those found within the game and do not necessarily refer to accurate information.
paragraphs.text: The game includes information on characters from the show and instructions on how to play, in addition to the quiz itself. The questions and answers provided on this page represent those found within the game and do not necessarily refer to accurate information.

paragraphs.body: There was a section included in this trivia game that provided basic information on several characters from the second book.
paragraphs.text: There was a section included in this trivia game that provided basic information on several characters from the second book.

paragraphs.body: The quiz was the main component of this game and was where all trivia questions pertaining to episodes are answered in order to receive access codes for Dark Into Light. Each quiz was meant to correspond to an episode, apart from the first quiz which encompasses the first two episodes, entitled "Night of a Thousand Starts". Every quiz consisted of ten randomized trivia questions pertaining to events that occurred in its respective episode, with each question having a time limit of twenty seconds.
paragraphs.text: The quiz was the main component of this game and was where all trivia questions pertaining to episodes are answered in order to receive access codes for Dark Into Light. Each quiz was meant to correspond to an episode, apart from the first quiz which encompasses the first two episodes, entitled "Night of a Thousand Starts". Every quiz consisted of ten randomized trivia questions pertaining to events that occurred in its respective episode, with each question having a time limit of twenty seconds.

paragraphs.body: All ten questions had to be answered correctly within the time allotted in order to obtain the secret code at the end of the trivia; if one question was answered incorrectly or was not answered within the given time, the quiz had to be retaken before the code was received. The same question would not be repeated in any one attempt.
paragraphs.text: All ten questions had to be answered correctly within the time allotted in order to obtain the secret code at the end of the trivia; if one question was answered incorrectly or was not answered within the given time, the quiz had to be retaken before the code was received. The same question would not be repeated in any one attempt.

paragraphs.body: This episode consisted of questions pertaining to both "${link_0}" and "${link_1}". It revealed the code Earth, Earth, Fire, Fire, Air which unlocked a secret mission in stage two, in which a stuffed ${link_2} plush toy must be found.
section: Episode 01: Night of a Thousand Starts
paragraphs.text: This episode consisted of questions pertaining to both "Rebel Spirit" and "The Southern Lights". It revealed the code Earth, Earth, Fire, Fire, Air which unlocked a secret mission in stage two, in which a stuffed Appa plush toy must be found.

section: Episode 09: Night of a Thousand Stars
paragraphs.text: This episode consisted of questions pertaining to both "Night of a Thousand Stars" and "Harmonic Convergence". It revealed the code Fire, Water, Earth, Fire, Air.

paragraphs.body: The quiz claimed that Korra used airbending to pass through Unalaq's blockade. In truth, she used waterbending to create a massive wave that displaced the ships.
paragraphs.text: The quiz claimed that Korra used airbending to pass through Unalaq's blockade. In truth, she used waterbending to create a massive wave that displaced the ships.

paragraphs.body: The quiz claimed that Korra wanted to convince General Iroh to send troops to the South. In truth, her main objective was to convince President Raiko.
paragraphs.text: The quiz claimed that Korra wanted to convince General Iroh to send troops to the South. In truth, her main objective was to convince President Raiko.

paragraphs.body: The quiz claimed that Korra found Desna and Eska on her way to Varrick. In truth, Korra ran into Asami and did not encounter her cousins until she left for the Fire Nation.
paragraphs.text: The quiz claimed that Korra found Desna and Eska on her way to Varrick. In truth, Korra ran into Asami and did not encounter her cousins until she left for the Fire Nation.

paragraphs.body: The quiz claimed that Lightning Bolt Zolt was present during the sting operation and had a conversation with Shady Shin which Mako overheard. In truth, Lightning Bolt Zolt was absent from the sting operation and it was ${link_0} conversing with Shady Shin.
paragraphs.text: The quiz claimed that Lightning Bolt Zolt was present during the sting operation and had a conversation with Shady Shin which Mako overheard. In truth, Lightning Bolt Zolt was absent from the sting operation and it was Viper conversing with Shady Shin.

paragraphs.body: The quiz claimed that Asami overheard the details of the triad's double-crossing. In truth, she was not present when this was revealed and was only made aware of the situation by Mako.
paragraphs.text: The quiz claimed that Asami overheard the details of the triad's double-crossing. In truth, she was not present when this was revealed and was only made aware of the situation by Mako.

paragraphs.body: The quiz claimed that all spirits turned dark following Korra's tantrum. In truth, the dragon bird spirit and Iroh were not affected.
paragraphs.text: The quiz claimed that all spirits turned dark following Korra's tantrum. In truth, the dragon bird spirit and Iroh were not affected.
